word: When they heaped abuse on Him,
parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To revile a person to his face, abuse insultingly. From loidoros; to reproach, i.e. Vilify.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To abuse in return, give abuse for abuse. From anti and loidoreo; to rail in reply.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: I am acted upon in a certain way, either good or bad; I experience ill treatment, suffer.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To threaten, forbid by threatening. Of uncertain derivation; to menace; by implication, to forbid.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From para and didomi; to surrender, i.e yield up, intrust, transmit.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Dative Masculine Singular
str2: Properly, to distinguish, i.e. Decide; by implication, to try, condemn, punish.
Justly, righteously. Adverb from dikaios; equitably.
